Episode 2 makes a single change that should be patched into Half Life 2 and Episode 1 with how critical it is. 

Sprint energy is separate from Flashlight energy. This is honest to god the most vital change you could ever make to this game. 

In all seriousness I'm recommending this because if I don't I'm sure someone will kill me for not recommending the entire Half Life 2 trilogy. Also because this ones actually far superior to the previous 2 in terms of combat, pacing, and aesthetic. It also features the track Vortal Combat which is still one of my favourite tracks out of the Half Life 2 OST's. 

The story to this one actually matters now (Yaaaay) and instead of being "Gordon wanders out of City 17 with his wacky sidekick Alyx in tow" it now has some stakes beyond your death and the environments are the best that Half Life 2 has seen so far. 

Although they retcon a new character in which is honestly a weird decision this late into the story. Especially since this new scientist exists only to be a dick to you. Which is fine because I was going to throw up if they introduced another character who sucks off your e-peen because "Oh my God isn't Gordon so cool, look at him crowbar everything to death!"

Can I just address this here by the way? Stop making Gordon out to be this messiah type character who can kill literally everyone with just a crowbar please. You hardly use the thing for anything beyond breaking barriers or beating on headcrabs. It's a panic weapon that only shows up because it's iconic. 

I mean if anything shouldn't the pistol, the lock on rocket launcher, the shotgun, or ANY of the other guns be Gordon's ol' reliable? 

"Wow Jinx sounds like you have a stick up your ass over such an inconsequential thing huh?" 

Well yeah I do but that's why I make these reviews in the first place. So I can joke and praise stuff while also being a complete ass clown about it. And also point out how silly it is that a weapon that Gordon picked up in Half Life 1 out of desperation is now somehow this god tier weapon that could kill everything because "haha 90's melee conventions are so cool and quirky"

So yes I do have an irrational hatred of this but mainly because if you were truly a cool game protagonist you'd not waste time putting your gun away to pull out a melee weapon like a little bitch and just smack your enemy with your fist or the butt of your gun. 

Overall Half Life Series 2 Episode 2 Part 1: Revengeance is pretty good as far as video games go so I mean. That's neat. Valve still haven't given us the MP5 back as Gordon's SMG though so honestly 0/10 give me back the cool gun.

Playing this one again before HLA drives home a few things: first it makes Epsiode 1 look pretty week in comparison (though it is still good) and second you do really see across the episodes just how much they were setting up for the stuff that happened in Epistle 3 and it is really sad they took this long to follow up. This is peak Half-Life, the combat encounters are some of the best in the series, the level design is wonderfully open, and it still looks stellar along with a vibrant forest theme that's unlike anything else in the series. This one really pushed some of the worldbuilding and almost revealed a lot of exciting lore. Valve explicitly says to play this one before HLA so hopefully we see some of these threads come back.
As for the other episodes, I fully recommend playing this game. Fun action, suspence and exhilarating!

Despite Half-Life ending on a never-to-be-completed cliffhanger, the Half-Life community over the years has filled the void Valve left unfinished with mods and even standalone games. While I still hold them because they never finished the trilogy, I can't thank them enough for creating the diverse game library of community games that wouldn't have been possible without the free-to-use Source engine.
